answers.answer: Get an insulin pump!  There is a large learning curve, but it is very freeing.   It allows you to eat more freely by counting carbs, and it keeps your blood sugar more stable.  My husband has had type 1 for 30 years and a pump for only 5.  He wished he would have gotten it a long time ago.  Now my son is type 1 and has an insulin pump from Medtronic Mini med - and he is only 4.  You can wear it during sports and it is invisible. There are many different types - even an omnipod is a great pump for teenagers, because it has no wires and is not visible to anyone else.Most doctors will approve you getting an insulin pump if you have been on shots for at least 6 months.  You do HAVE to commit to checking your blood sugar though, or it will not be successful.

title: living with type 1
